meta.title: Abdullah Cavus - Control and Automation Engineer
meta.description: A selection of works from the portfolio of Abdullah CAVUS, embedded developer.

projects.title: Embedded Software
projects.description: Currently, I am working with embedded system software at Bilko. In our projects, we use STM32 and Nuvoton brand microcontrollers. In my own projects, I generally use ESP32 and STM32F series microcontrollers.

projects.title: PCB Design
projects.description: I started hardware design with Proteus at MHM Robotics, the first place I worked. Later, I made designs with KiCAD and EasyEDA at ROBOGOR. Currently, besides embedded software, I also do hardware designs at Bilko. Below, you can see some of the PCBs I have designed before.

credits.Gear Control Board | 2021: One of the projects I did in my own company. I designed and manufactured the circuit of gear control boards to be used in a company's vehicles.
credits.E-Seal | 2020: A circuit with GPRS, Bluetooth, and other hardware that I designed as part of the E-Seal project during my time at Robogör.
credits.Red-Kit | 2018: A product I designed during my time at MHM Robotics for use in children's robotic coding education, which is still being sold. Product Link.

projects.title: Robotics
projects.description: My robotics journey started with a line-following robot in the early days of university. Later, I worked on various land vehicles and quadcopters. Currently, in my spare time, I am working on my thesis project, a snake-like robot. My goal is to create the kinematic equations of the snake-like robot using reinforcement learning. I am doing my simulation work with CoppeliaSim. You can follow my work on YouTube.

projects.title: UI Projects
projects.description: I create many programs for use in projects. I usually use Python with QT for the interface. Below, you can see some of the programs I have made.

credits.Ballance: A ball and plate project we made for the Phoenix Contact Competition with the YTUROK team, where the motors are controlled by PLC. In this project, I prepared the interface, image processing, and modbus communication parts.
credits.Video Editor:
I made this program for a company providing live broadcast services in my own business. With this program, you can quickly cut a video, combine videos from marked places, and add transition videos between them.
I made the program cross-platform using PyQT5 and ffmpeg. I prepared the timeline and markers seen in the GIF from scratch using QPainter and QPen.
